HSystem

Simple application householding system.

Designed as single instance.

HSystem is used to keep HApplication instances in order.  HApplication itself calls HSystem, so there is no real need to access HSystem itself besides its HSystem.stopApp, HSystem.startApp, HSystem.reniceApp and HSystem.killApp methods.

HSystem works as the root of the component hierachy and currently offers only HApplication management.  Useful for implementing taskbars/docks etc.

Summary
HSystem
Simple application householding system.
HDefaultApplicationInterval
Instance variables
scheduler
Calls applications, uses the divmod as a prioritizer.
ticker
Calls the scheduler and then calls itself.
addApp
Called from inside the HApplication constructor.
startApp
Starts polling an app instance (and its components).
stopApp
Stops polling an app instance (and its components).
reniceApp
Changes the priority of the app.
killApp
Stops polling and deletes an app instance (and its components).

HDefaultApplicationInterval

  • Defines the default ms interval of polling.
  • Defaults to 100 (ms)
  • Change it before Element Manager.onloader is started.
  • Has no effect after the system is initialized.

Instance variables

type’[HSystem]’
appsA list of Applications running.
defaultIntervalThe default application priority.

See Also

HApplication

Usage example

var MyApp = new HApplication();
myAppId = MyApp.appId;
HSystem.reniceApp(myAppId, 10);
HSystem.killApp(myAppId);

scheduler

scheduler: function()

Calls applications, uses the divmod as a prioritizer.

ticker

ticker: function()

Calls the scheduler and then calls itself.

addApp

addApp: function(_appClass,
_refreshInterval)

Called from inside the HApplication constructor.  Binds an app and gives it a unique id.

Parameters

_appClassUsually this inside the HApplication constructor, is the app namespace.
_refreshIntervalThe interval (in ms) to poll the app and its components.

Returns

The application unique id.

See also

HApplication

startApp

startApp: function(_appId,
_refreshInterval)

Starts polling an app instance (and its components).

Parameters

_appIdThe unique id of the app.
_refreshIntervalThe interval (in ms) to poll the app and its components.

See also

<HApplication.start> HSystem.stopApp HSystem.reniceApp

stopApp

stopApp: function(_appId)

Stops polling an app instance (and its components).

Parameters

_appIdThe unique id of the app.

See also

<HApplication.stop> HSystem.startApp HSystem.reniceApp

reniceApp

reniceApp: function(_appId,
_refreshInterval)

Changes the priority of the app.  Calls stopApp and startApp.

Parameters

_appIdThe unique id of the app.
_refreshIntervalThe interval (in ms) to poll the app and its components.

See also

HSystem.stopApp HSystem.startApp

killApp

killApp: function(_appId,
_forced)

Stops polling and deletes an app instance (and its components).

Parameters

_appIdThe unique id of the app.

See also

Interface function to add code as strings to the “onload”-event buffer.
